strIntroduction: This evening tour takes you southwest of the city, travelling through the rural countryside. Reaching Kuala Selangor Wetland Reserve, you will be rewarded with a breathtaking scenery of the mangrove forests, home to an incredibly nocturnal beetle commonly called firefly.

With your expert, friendly guide, you’ll discover the important work the elephant sanctuary does in protecting and safeguarding these orphaned elephants.

strIntroduction: Enjoy an exciting day out as you set off for Forest Research Institute Malaysia or FRIM, and discover the wonders of the tropical rainforest. Founded by the British colonial forest scientist in 1929, FRIM offers a back-to-nature experience whilst enjoying the flora and fauna in a natural ecosystem. Within this fascinating institute, there are jungle trails, canopy walkway, waterfalls, a library and a museum, housing a small collection of the nation's rich forest heritage.

Explore the traditional typical houses of Borneo ethnic communities and see their ancient life style through a museum type cultural village. Join the in-house activities by exploring the village with activities such as tasting Rice Wine, trying Bamboo Fire Starter, getting a HannaTattoo, try Blow-Pipe, Traditional Dance and many more.
strTitle: Borneo Cultural Village one day tour

Libaran Island lies on the north-eastern coast of Sabah, about 40 minutes boat ride from Sandakan and five minutes away from the main islands of Sabah’s Turtle Island Park. Libaran Island support about 450 inhabitants whose main livelihood being fishing and boat making. Turtles are known to come ashore and lay their eggs on the island.

strIntroduction: A jewel-like tiny island in the Sulu Sea, a 1.5 hour boat rides north of Sandakan; Lankayan has been declared part of an immense Marine Protected Area to adopt the eco-tourism concept. Unpopulated and covered  by thick tropical island vegetation on its topside, this peaceful, untouched  little bit of paradise is ringed by an endless pure white sandy beach, offering  simply elegant and exquisite accommodation in all 23 wooden, roomy and  perfectly appointed seafront chalets.
